meanings.definition: The quality or state of being warm.
meanings.sent1: I love the warmth of the sun on my face.
meanings.sent2: The blanket provided much-needed warmth on the cold night.
meanings.sent3: The cat snuggled up to me for warmth on the chilly evening.
meanings.sent4: Her smile radiated a warmth that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the fireplace made the whole house cozy.

meanings.sent1: The warmth of the spices added a nice flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent2: She could feel the warmth of the fire as she approached the campsite.
meanings.sent3: The warmth of the freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a comforting warmth that put everyone at ease.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the summer sun made the sand hot to the touch.

meanings.sent1: The warmth of her hug melted away all my worries.
meanings.sent2: His eyes sparkled with warmth as he greeted his old friend.
meanings.sent3: The warmth of the welcome party made me feel instantly at home.
meanings.sent4: Her words were filled with a genuine warmth that touched my heart.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of their laughter echoed through the room.
